ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: American traditional values, things that should be paid attention to during cross cultrue communication, tips for college essays writing and different concepts about time.
I think my reading skill was improved through this class.  All of the scripts were good to read, think and discuss. The discussions were also good for me.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is very cool. And I think it can be organized much better if we have more regular assignment and feedback.
Maybe we can have more reading materials after class (just my own opinion)

I thought the difficulties of the class were different, and it dependet on the teacher. For example, I didn't have homework so much, but my friends in different teacher's class of this course had a lot of homework everyday. If the amount of homework become the same, this course will be better and better, I think.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would. Because we can improve our english skills here and get a lot of fun here.
Yes I would. Skills leart from this course can be of value to college study in United States.

Yes, of course. I haven't been good at talking in English before I've come to Yale, but through this course I could communicated with other students much better in English. 
Moreover, I got many friends from all over the world and I could know many other perspectives or ways of thinking.
These are the reasons why I recommend this course to other students.
